business.headline: Sensex, Nifty rebound: Will the relief rally on D-Street continue or fizzle out?Stock market today: While the market did show some signs of recovery today, the sharp decline in the final hours has left retail investors in an uncertain situation.

Sensex surges 1,000 points. All you need to know in 5 pointsThe rally saw the market capitalisation of all listed companies on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) jump by Rs 6.06 lakh crore to Rs 435.14 lakh crore.

NTPC Green Energy IPO: 3 reasons why you should subscribeNTPC Green Energy IPO: The subscription for NTPC Green Energy IPO will close on November 22, 2024 and the price band is set between Rs 102 and Rs 108 per share.

Honasa Consumer share price tumbles over 30% in two trading sessions. What next?Honasa Consumer share price: The sharp sell-off was triggered by a disappointing set of September quarter results and concerns over the company's near-term growth outlook.

Explained: Why Suzlon Energy share price hit 5% upper circuit today Suzlon Energy share price: The jump in its share price came after brokerage Morgan Stanley upgraded the stock to 'Overweight' from 'Equal-weight.'

Is it a good time to buy gold? 3 things you should knowGold Price Today: On the MCX, gold futures maturing on December 5, 2024, were priced at Rs 75,450 per 10 grams, reflecting an increase of Rs 403 or 0.54%. The previous close was Rs 75,047.
IRFC, RVNL, IRCTC, IRCON: Why these railway stocks are gaining todayRailway stocks saw sharp gains during the session, led by IRFC, which rose over 5%.

Zinka Logistics IPO allotment: How to check status, latest GMP and other detailsZinka Logistics IPO allotment: Investors can check their allotment status on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) website or through the registrar, KFin Technologies.

Nirmala Sitharaman calls for 'affordable' interest rates after Piyush GoyalThe Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) has kept key interest rates unchanged since February 2023, citing persistent inflation pressures.

Sensex surges 1,000 points, snaps 7-session losing streak. Is the worst over?Sensex today: At 11:36 am, the Sensex was up 1044.89 points at 78,383.90, while the NSE Nifty50 advanced 304.50 points to 23,758.30.

ED likely to summon top Amazon, Flipkart executives over FDI rule violationsThe ED's investigation stems from multiple complaints alleging that Amazon and Flipkart have been violating Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) rules by directly or indirectly favouring select vendors.

Boeing to cut over 2,500 workers in US amid financial crisisNearly 2,200 layoff notices went to workers in Washington and another 220 in South Carolina, the two states where Boeing builds commercial airliners. Boeing declined to comment on the layoffs on Monday.

Gold, silver price today, November 19, 2024: Precious metals record hike on MCXGold Price Today: Both gold and silver are trading on the higher side of the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Tuesday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.

Meta to appeal India's Rs 213-crore penalty order over WhatsApp policyThe Competition Commission of India (CCI) on Monday imposed a penalty of Rs 213.14 crore on social media major Meta for unfair business ways with respect to WhatsApp privacy policy update done in 2021.

NTPC Green Energy IPO open for bidding: Should you subscribe? Check latest GMPNTPC Green Energy IPO: The initial public offering (IPO) makes NTPC Green Energy the third-largest IPO of the year, following Hyundai Motors India's Rs 28,756 crore IPO and Swiggy's Rs 11,327 crore issue.
Shaktikanta Das' tenure as RBI governor likely to be extended: Report Shaktikanta Das, who has been heading the RBI since December 2018, has already surpassed the typical five-year term.
Market rally: Sensex, Nifty rebound to open higher; RIL gains 1% The S&P BSE Sensex added 663.48 points to 78,002.49, while the NSE Nifty50 was up 203.85 points to 23,657.65
Meta fined Rs 213 crore over WhatsApp privacy policy by competition regulatorThe Competition Commission of India has directed Meta to "cease and desist" from anti-competitive practices.
Sensex, Nifty extend losses amid weak rupee and IT sector declineThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 241.30 points to close at 77,339.01, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 78.90 points to end at 23,453.80.

Will Bitcoin's revival boost India's appetite for cryptos despite high taxes?The crypto market has been riding a wave of optimism following Donald Trump's election as US president, with hopes that his administration will adopt a crypto-friendly stance.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Maharashtra BJP leader accused of distributing cash for votes, he denies claimVinod Tawde has denied the accusations despite a video going viral of BVA workers storming into a hotel in Nalasopara during a meeting between the BJP leader and Rajan Naik, the BJP candidate from the Assembly seat.

Artificial rain needed: Delhi flags air emergency, seeks Centre's nodDelhi AQI: The Delhi Minister's letter to the Centre comes as the national capital is battling with deteriorating air pollution levels. On Tuesday, the Air Quality Index stood at 494 under the 'severe plus' category.

Biden, Trudeau, Italy's Meloni MIA from G20 leaders' group pictureFrustrated US officials blamed "logistical issues" for the blunder, which meant that Joe Biden missed out on the shot, along with the Canadian and Italian Prime Ministers Justin Trudeau and Giorgia Meloni, respectively.

VPN use violates Islamic law: Pak's top cleric days after Shehbaz Sharif's X post Million of Pakistanis have been unable to access the X social media platform since February 2023, when the government blocked it ahead of parliamentary elections, except via VPN — a service that hides online activity from anyone else on the internet.

Diljit Dosanjh replaces alcohol with Coke in song's lyrics, Coca-Cola reacts Diljit Dosanjh Hyderabad Concert Video: Diljit Dosanjh replaced the lyrics of his song which mentioned alcohol with Coca-Cola at his Hyderabad concert. The company reacted to one of the viral videos of his performance.
Poll body files FIR against Maharashtra BJP's Vinod Tawde over cash-for-votes chargeElection Commission files FIR against Maharashtra BJP's Vinod Tawde over cash-for-votes charge

Retiring Rafael Nadal gets heartfelt message from 'fan' Roger FedererRoger Federer wrote an emotional farewell message to Rafael Nadal as the Spaniard gets ready for his last tournament as a professional tennis player. Nadal will turn up for Spain in the Davis Cup Finals between November 19 and 24.
Russia expands nuclear threshold as US eases restrictions on UkraineThis follows US President Joe Biden's decision to let Ukraine strike targets inside Russia with US-supplied longer-range missiles.

1000 days of Russia-Ukraine war: Life in picturesA photo essay capturing 1,000 days of the Russia-Ukraine war—depicting destruction, resilience, and hope through images of survival, loss, and the enduring spirit to rebuild and dream of peace.

Are Indians driving birth tourism in Canada? Here's the truthIn a video that has gone viral, a Canadian named claimed Indian women were flooding Canada's hospitals for childbirth. This phenomenon is called 'birth tourism', and is aimed at gaining Canadian citizenship for the newborn. But are Indians driving birth tourism in Canada? This is what data says.

Why Maharashtra election is to blame for onion-less salad, runny gravyMaharashtra Election: Onion prices have remained very high for some months now and are driving temporary culinary changes. One of the measures the Centre takes to tackle high onion prices is to stop exports. However, with the upcoming elections in Maharashtra, India's biggest onion producer, the government has dithered in doing so.

Comedian Samay Raina wants 'ad revenue' from Deepika Padukone depression jokeIndia's Got Latent creator and comedian Samay Raina asked people to help him monetise the Deepika Padukone depression 'joke' from his show. He reacted on Instagram after outrage over the contentious joke.
Sunita Williams's health: How the astronaut tracks her sleep in spaceStudies have revealed that crew members sleep significantly less during spaceflight compared to pre- and post-mission periods.

Rishabh Pant breaks silence on leaving Delhi Capitals: 'Not about money' IPL Auction: Wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant, in a surprising move, was not retained by Delhi Capitals ahead of the mega auction. Pant took to social media and said their split was not because of money.

From Maharashtra to Telangana: Tiger Johnny travels 300 km in search of mateA male tiger, named Johnny, travelled 300 km from Maharashtra to Telangana, apparently to find a mate. The tiger's journey, which began in the third week of October, was tracked by a radio collar.

Court relief for actor Siddique in rape case: 'Facebook post but no complaint'The charges against actor Siddique came as a spate of sexual misconduct allegations rocked the Malayalam film industry earlier this year. During the hearing, the Supreme Court asked the complainant why it took eight years to lodge the complaint.

Nayanthara Beyond The Fairytale review: Wholesome story of successful woman in love Released-Mon Nov 18, 2024Nayanthara: Beyond The Fairytale on Netflix is the story of an ordinary woman who happens to be a star, not because she was served stardom on a platter, but because she worked hard for it. This is the story of earning power, showing strength, and making every success count with a bit of dreaminess.

Maharashtra, India's miracle state, finds itself at a crossroadsDespite its perennial record of delivering high economic growth and manifesting progressive social values, caste-based fault-lines and mass unemployment now clutch the state. Can India's economic powerhouse revive its fractured polity to yet again emerge as a 'miracle'?

Canadian police rule out foul play in Sikh woman's death in Walmart ovenA month after a 19-year-old Sikh woman, Gursimran Kaur, was found dead at a Walmart store oven in Canada, police declared her death non-suspicious, finding no evidence of foul play.

'Capability, not seat strength, to decide MVA chief minister': Jayant PatilThe NCP (SCP) leader says women's security, farmers' welfare and inflation will be the MVA government's top priorities. An exclusive interview

Pakistani influencer Mathira Mohammad reacts after alleged private video leakMathira Mohammad spoke out after alleged private videos were leaked online, claiming her name was misused to spread fake content.

Delhi chokes in smog, AQI at 494; flights delayed, schools go online Live Updates Delhi AQI: Air quality across the national capital region has deteriorated, with several air monitoring stations crossing the 490 mark on Tuesday.

Trump confirms plans for military use for mass deportation of illegal migrantsDonald Trump has promised the "largest deportation program" of migrants "in the history of America", once he assumes power.

Pic: Vikrant Massey meets Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath at his Lucknow residenceVikrant Massey recently met Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath in Lucknow following the release of his film The Sabarmati Report, which has garnered praise from Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Amit Shah for its narrative.
Watch: Nia Sharma grooves to Chammak Challo with Akon in Abu DhabiNia Sharma attended Akon's concert on a cruise in Abu Dhabi. The TV actor was seen grooving to Chammak Challo on the stage.

Decoding rise and rise of Allu Arjun and why Pushpa 2 Patna launch is iconicAllu Arjun is the first South Indian actor to host the trailer launch event of his upcoming film Pushpa 2 in Patna, the heartland of the Hindi belt. Pushpa 2: The Rule will release in theatres on December 5.

Choreographer Jani Master makes 1st public appearance after bail, thanks wifeChoreographer Jani Master recently attended a pre-release event of a film after being granted bail in the POCSO case. He expressed his gratitude towards his wife for supporting him through his tough time.

sports.headline: India pull out of Blind T20 World Cup in Pakistan after no government clearanceSailendra Yadav, general secretary of the Indian blind cricket association, speaking to India Today, confirmed that the government denied nod for the team to travel to Pakistan, which will host the Blind T20 World Cup from November 23.

Border-Gavaskar Trophy: Jasprit Bumrah reveals India's key to success in seriesJasprit Bumrah has revealed the Indian team's key to success in Australia ahead of the upcoming Border-Gavaskar Trophy, starting on November 22. Bumrah will lead India in the series opener.

No Rishabh Pant? Delhi may spend Rs 15-20 crore for his replacement, says GavaskarSunil Gavaskar has said that Delhi Capitals would be willing to splash Rs. 15-20 crores for a replacement for Rishabh Pant during the IPL 2025 auction. Gavaskar feels DC could target Ishan Kishan as the replacement for Pant.

India focus on slip catching on first training day at Perth Stadium: Top highlightsTeam India kicked off their preparations for the upcoming Test series with an intensive training session at the iconic Optus Stadium in Perth. The session focused on fielding, batting drills, and acclimatization to Australian conditions three days ahead of the series opener.

India low on confidence, but Australia won't underestimate them: LabuschagneBorder_Gavaskar Trophy: Marnus Labuschagne, speaking to reporters in Perth on Tuesday, cautioned against underestimating India even as the visitors arrived in Australia on the back of a shocking 0-3 defeat to New Zealand in a home Test series.

Give Nathan McSweeney time, hope Marnus Labuschagne has a big series: WarnerDavid Warner has urged the Australia selectors to be patient with Nathan McSweeney in the opener's role. Warner also expects Marnus Labuschagne to return to form against India during the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

Rajitha, Embuldeniya back in Sri Lanka Test squad for South Africa seriesSouth Africa vs Sri Lanka: Fast-bowler Kasun Rajitha has been named in Sri Lanka's squad for the two-match Test series against South Africa beginning on November 29.

With Shubman Gill and Rohit Sharma unavailable, the team is searching for replacements at the top of the order. Visuals from the nets, shared on social media, suggest that Devdutt Padikkal and Dhruv Jurel are likely to get a nod.

Rohit Sharma's call to miss Perth Test defended by Michael Clarke: Family firstMichael Clarke has come out in support of Rohit Sharma's decision to miss the Perth Test and be with his family as he welcomed his second child. Rohit and his wife Ritika welcomed a baby boy on November 15.

Rishabh Pant breaks silence on leaving Delhi Capitals: 'Not about money' IPL Auction: Wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant, in a surprising move, was not retained by Delhi Capitals ahead of the mega auction. Pant took to social media and said their split was not because of money.

Backdoor talks on to convince Pakistan on hybrid Champions Trophy Top cricket administrators are trying to convince Pakistan to start working towards a hybrid model for the marquee eight-team tournament. PCB chairman Mohsin Naqvi, on Monday, reiterated Pakistan's stance, offering to ease India's safety concerns.

Mike Tyson-Jake Paul fight draws record betting for a combat sports eventJake Paul secured a unanimous victory over former heavyweight champion Mike Tyson, a result that may have been underwhelming from a competitive perspective but nevertheless attracted record betting activity.

OTD in 2023, Australia win World Cup: When Cummins silenced the Ahmedabad crowdOn this day in 2023:  November 19 will forever echo as a day of heartbreak for Indian cricket, as dreams of glory crumbled before a resolute Australian side that thrived against all odds. In a deafening silence at the world's largest stadium, hope turned to despair as the coveted World Cup slipped away from the home team.

No Shafali Verma as India name squad for women's ODI series in AustraliaDynamic opener Shafali Verma was not picked as India named their 16-member squad for the upcoming three-match women's ODI series against Australia. Shafali managed just 56 runs in the recent home series against New Zealand, with her last ODI half-century dating back to July 2022.

Australia's Pat Cummins eager to 'tick off' Test series win over IndiaPat Cummins has never been part of a victorious Test series against India, but the Australian captain is determined to change that in the upcoming Border-Gavaskar Trophy, which begins on November 22 in Perth.

Who will be India's Kohli and Shastri in Australia this time, asks Vaughan Border-Gavaskar Trophy: Former England captain Michael Vaughan highlighted the role of powerful leaders like Virat Kohli and Ravi Shastri in the dressing room in their previous two tours to Australia.

Jasprit Bumrah is India's X-factor, incredible in every format: Travis HeadBorder-Gavaskar Trophy: Australian batter Travis Head has lauded Jasprit Bumrah as a formidable challenge for Australian batters, highlighting his unpredictable bowling style.

No Rohit and Gill for India in Perth Test: Top 5 options to bat in top-orderTeam India find themselves in a precarious position as they're without their captain, Rohit Sharma, for the first Test in Perth. The situation worsened with Shubman Gill's injury. India will have to reshuffle their batting line-up and ensure they get the combination right for the series opener, starting November 22.

Alex Carey unfazed by Josh Inglis's challenge for Test wicketkeeper roleAlex Carey is unfazed by another wicketkeeper, Josh Inglis,'s addition to Australia's Test squad. Carey highlighted his camaraderie with Inglis in the "Keepers Club" despite competing for the wicketkeeper role.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
